rename.to: Get Psalm job to pass with DBAL 3

issue.title: Get PHPUnit to run with DBAL 3
issue.body:
[Recently, a CI job was added on the 2.10.x branch to run the test suite this project after forcing the installation of `doctrine/dbal` v3](https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/8874).

In order not to disrupt contributors, we made sure it would not fail the build although it really does not pass at all:

https://github.com/doctrine/orm/blob/e09f126abfec0add53dc1ed8d4e3708117032fc1/.github/workflows/static-analysis.yml#L52

Right now, we get a crash without PHPUnit actually running, so we don't even know how many errors and failures there will be in the end. A good first step would be to fix that crash and get to a state where you can see the whole test suite running (with errors and failures)
If you want to help us fix it or get closer to fixing it, you can reproduce the issue locally by running (from the 2.10.x branch)

```shell
composer require doctrine/dbal ^3.0
vendor/bin/phpunit
```

When this issue is fixed, we should create a new one about making the tests pass.

body: One of the loudest issue are changes introduced in https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/commit/5d03f6e443e8d444bf9917ca44b1b553ecaa4896 - it affects `Doctrine\ORM\Configuration` class. I wonder if it would be better to switch to the dedicated property per each config value, or stays with `$_attributes` property to keep backward compatibility with classes that might extend `Doctrine\ORM\Configuration`.

Maybe re-declaring the property in the ORM class would solve the issue. Switching to a dedicated property per config value in the ORM class is a separate thing IMO, it can be done fully independently I think.

issue.title: doctrine/dbal v3 - Make sure that values passed to are not null
issue.body:
Hello! My first PR here. 
Partially fixes #8884 - 7 out of 117 issues. 

Let's start from fixing 2 types of issues:
```
[0;31mERROR[0m: PossiblyNullArgument - lib/Doctrine/ORM/Persisters/Collection/ManyToManyPersister.php:765:66 - Argument 3 of Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform::modifyLimitQuery cannot be null, possibly null value provided (see https://psalm.dev/078)
            return $this->platform->modifyLimitQuery('', $limit, [97;41m$offset[0m);

[0;31mERROR[0m: PossiblyNullArgument - lib/Doctrine/ORM/Persisters/Entity/JoinedSubclassPersister.php:335:62 - Argument 2 of Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform::appendLockHint cannot be null, possibly null value provided (see https://psalm.dev/078)
        $lock       = $this->platform->appendLockHint($from, [97;41m$lockMode[0m);
```
The first issue is simpler - `modifyLimitQuery` has default `$offset` value set to `0` - so let's pass it instead of `null`. 
For `AbstractPlatform::appendLockHint` there is no default value, so passing `LockMode::NONE` seems to be the best choice - it would not affect any known implementation.

body: The last type of errors seems to be connected with things that has been deprecated in `doctrine/dbal` 2.x and removed in 3.x, for example: https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/3211 . Do you think that it will be fine to thrown exception in that case if somebody is trying to use such functionalities with `doctrine/orm:2.10.x` and `doctrine/dbal:3.x`? It looks like all of such cases are marked as deprecated in `doctrine/orm:2.10.x`.

Sure. 
`UuidGenerator` is using `getGuidExpression` function that has been removed in dbal 3.x doctrine/dbal#3211 
https://github.com/doctrine/orm/blob/f3e55fae9fdbdbc23897006bdbf016c20e11f6e9/lib/Doctrine/ORM/Id/UuidGenerator.php#L36
There is no internal replacement for this method - just suggested to use ramsey/uuid instead. 

I can try to split it by case and create separate PRs for each issue :)

Oh right, I even deprecated this in https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/8813 . If we want to have DBAL v3 with ORM v2, then I think we should indeed throw an exception letting people know they need to run `composer require doctrine/dbal ^2.0` if they wish to continue using this feature.

> I can try to split it by case and create separate PRs for each issue 

That would be a great approach üëç

issue.title: Address Type deprecation messages
issue.body:
This makes us more compatible with DBAL v3.
We didn't address `Type::JSON_ARRAY` because it has been removed

Refs #8884, #8885
